https://www.mintcopywritingstudios.com/b.rawText:
Top 18 Fintech Newsletters (That Include Deep Dives)
    

    


  There’s a lot of fintech newsletters to choose from, and a lot of articles listing the top fintech newsletters.But many of them focus on listing fintech newsletters that just cover the recent news or funding announcements. As avid readers of newsletters ourselves, we know that it’s often the additional commentary and unique insights and analysis that make newsletters great.In this list of fintech newsletters, you’ll find newsletters that offer unique insights and commentary that you won’t find anywhere else. Looking for more fintech content? See our other lists:[Top 8 Fintech Blogs to Bookmark](https://www.mintcopywritingstudios.com/blog/fintech-blogs) [Top 25 Fintech Influencers](https://www.mintcopywritingstudios.com/blog/fintech-influencers) Let’s begin.Note: are you a fintech company looking for support with content? We’re a content marketing agency that helps fintech companies turn their blog into a customer acquisition channel. [Book a consultation](https://www.mintcopywritingstudios.com/free-content-marketing-consultation)  to find out more!0. Mint Studios Content Marketing Fintech newsletterSince we’re the ones writing the article, we thought it would make sense to include ours. In this monthly newsletter, we write about all things content and fintech.Every month, we send out a newsletter with our latest article and case studies, along with a featured fintech strategy or tactic that we’ve been experimenting with. Here’s an example of a recent Mint Studios newsletter: [Is it Possible to Start Seeing Results from Content Marketing within Month 2?](https://preview.mailerlite.com/b1v8k3f7s5) Interested in joining? Sign up below.





















  
  
























  
  





  
    
    
      
        
        
          
            
              Email Address
              
            
          
        
          
        
      
      
        
          
          Sign Up
          
        
      
      
        
      
    
    
    Thank you!
    
  




  1. [This Week in Fintech](https://thisweekinfintech.substack.com/)  by Nik Milanovic





















  
  














































  

    
  
    

      

      
        
          
        
        

        
          
            
          
            
                
                
                
                
                
                
                
                

            
          
        
          
        

        
      
        
      

    
  


  





  Nik’s newsletter includes the latest funding rounds, as well as interesting fintech deep dives. There is an additional newsletter for each each continent and region — specifically including UK and Europe, Asia, LATAM, Africa, the fund, treks and events.2. [Fintech Takes](https://newsletter.fintechtakes.com/)  by Alex Johnson





















  
  














































  

    
  
    

      

      
        
          
        
        

        
          
            
          
            
                
                
                
                
                
                
                
                

            
          
        
          
        

        
      
        
      

    
  


  





  Each Fintech Takes newsletter by Alex Johnson is a deep dive into an important fintech topic. Alex Johnson works in marketing for FICO, an analytics company that helps businesses with decision making. Instead of writing about weekly news, he focuses more on current trends. For example, at the time of writing (November 2020), Fintech trends include Banking as a Service and Buy Now Pay Later - so he’ll write a newsletter diving deep into those topics. He also sometimes interviews interesting guests which integrate well with the topic of the week. 3. [Fintech Brain Food](https://sytaylor.substack.com/)  by Simon Taylor





















  
  














































  

    
  
    

      

      
        
          
        
        

        
          
            
          
            
                
                
                
                
                
                
                
                

            
          
        
          
        

        
      
        
      

    
  


  





  Simon Taylor is a self professed Fintech geek, and really knows his stuff when it comes to the technical side of Fintech. Simon is the cofounder of 11FS and one of the hosts of the podcast. He also used to work at Barclays, which means he understands the incumbent world of banking better than most. His newsletter is more focused on the latest news, but with his own insights and analysis added on. He also covers cryptocurrencies, blockchain and a few other technical topics. He also adds new cool fintech companies that have recently launched or come across his radar, which is always fun to learn about.4. [Sifted](https://sifted.eu/) 





















  
  



 










































  

    
  
    

      

      
        
          
        
        

        
          
            
          
            
                
                
                
                
                
                
                
                

            
          
        
          
        

        
      
        
      

    
  


  


 


  Sifted is a publication for regular weekly news. They originally published only fintech news, but they now cover both tech and fintech. Sifted focuses specifically on tech in Europe, which makes it incredibly interesting and relevant for those who work in Europe.We always end up bookmarking several of their articles in their weekly newsletter, and have found some genuinely new insights and perspectives from their writers. Those are the four newsletters we are subscribed to. Here is a list of all the other fintech newsletters you’ll find:5. [Fintech business weekly](https://fintechbusinessweekly.substack.com/)  by Jason MikulaThe Business of Fintech: a fintech weekly newsletter offering in-depth analysis on trends and stories in retail [banking](https://www.mintcopywritingstudios.com/blog/content-marketing-for-banks) , fintech, and crypto.6. [Fintech R&R](https://jasshah.substack.com/)  by Jas ShahAn analysis of fintech topics from a product perspective. Sent every 2 weeks (and also includes puns and fun movie references!).7. [Net Interest](https://www.netinterest.co/)  by Marc RubinsteinFinancial markets and the fintech industry viewed through the lens of a 25yr hedge fund vet, delivered weekly.8. [A16z](https://info.a16z.com/newsletters-fintech.html) News and commentary on fintech, insurtech and proptech. Good coverage on all things technology news, artificial intelligence, roboadvisors and more.9. [Fintech blueprint](https://lex.substack.com/) The Fintech Blueprint helps you find and build the next Fintech & DeFi unicorn with unbiased and expert insights on financial innovation.10. [Marcel Van Oost](https://marcelvanoost.com/newsletter) His newsletters include:Deep dive FinTech and [financial services](https://www.mintcopywritingstudios.com/financial-services-content-marketing-agency)  market reportsPodcast recommendationsExclusive interviewsAccess to exclusive webinars11. [Fintech Today](https://fintechtoday.co/membership/) A fintech news roundup covering company & fintech startup news, funding, mergers and acquisitions, IPOs, regulation, and crypto.Our career corner, spotlighting the best open roles in our network at startups like Stir, Klarna, Coinbase, Petal, Eco, and more.Community highlights, celebrating our member’s accomplishments and achievements.12. [Sophie Guibaud’s Newsletter](https://sophieguibaud.substack.com/) Exploring how brands leverage financial technology to unlock new growth opportunities13. [Fintech radar](https://fintechradar.substack.com/) Fintech Radar is a weekly missive about all that's happening in the world of financial and fintech industry.14. [Future of fintech](https://newsletter.whitesight.net/) Fintech has been touted as the future of finance for quite some time now. Everything is becoming fintech and fintech will become everything, possibly. Although, for fintech to become everything the question arises – what does the future of fintech look like?Well, that's what we're setting out to discover through this newsletter aimed at nascent, emerging, and developing branches of fintech that we believe have the potential to become the future of the industry15. [WTFintech](https://workweek.com/brand/wtfintech/) Work in fintech? Get the industry news, insights, and analysis you need every Tuesday and Thursday from fintech reporter-turned-creator, Nicole Casperson — and tune into the podcast every Wednesday afternoon.16. [Pivot assets](https://www.pivotassets.co/) Stessa can tell you all about digital banking platforms, APIs, and Open Banking. She can even walk you through the history of the digital transition and digital transformation. But what really matters is how she can help you explore what banking and fintech can mean for you. 17. [The Financial Brand](https://thefinancialbrand.com/) Stay on top of all the latest trends transforming the banking industry today, and get actionable insights delivered straight to your inbox every week!18. [Fintech Weekly](https://www.fintechweekly.com/) Every week, Fintech Weekly sends out a newsletter with the most important stories in fintech of the week. They cover topics ranging from banking, crypto, sustainable finance to the future of work. And if you’re looking for [fintech podcasts](http://mintcopywritingstudios.com/blog/top-fintech-podcasts) , magazines and blogs, we highly recommend this resource: [Bank on Fintech](https://www.bankonfintech.com/fintech-content-hub) !And if you’re looking for PR agencies, check out our other article: [Top 13 Fintech PR Agencies (Based on Recommendations)](https://www.mintcopywritingstudios.com/blog/fintech-pr-agency) 





















  
  





    
      [Financial Services Thought Leadership](https://www.mintcopywritingstudios.com/blog/category/Financial+Services+Thought+Leadership) [Araminta Robertson](https://www.mintcopywritingstudios.com/blog?author=5dbc49decbdcde3d0870500e) May 20, 2023[1 Comment](https://www.mintcopywritingstudios.com/blog/top-fintech-newsletters#comments-62dfc083edd41e6d16bfe66e)

Tedium ](https://clickup.com/blog/tech-newsletters/#21-20-tedium-) [ Feeling Inspired to Create Your Own Newsletter? ](https://clickup.com/blog/tech-newsletters/#22-feeling-inspired-to-create-your-own-newsletter-) Start using ClickUp today Manage all your work in one place Collaborate with your team Use ClickUp for FREE—forever Get Started With information everywhere but real insights rare, keeping up with tech can feel like chasing a moving target.But what if the most effective tool for cutting through the noise is something as simple as your email inbox? The right tech newsletters can be your secret weapon for staying ahead of the curve. These curated digests deliver the most relevant and insightful content directly to your inbox, saving you time and effort.In this article, we’ll explore 20 essential tech newsletters that will help you stay updated.20 Essential Tech Newsletters to Keep You Updated[Why Should You Subscribe to Tech Newsletters?](https://clickup.com/blog/tech-newsletters/#0-why-should-you-subscribe-to-tech-newsletters-) [20 Top Tech Newsletters to Subscribe To](https://clickup.com/blog/tech-newsletters/#1-20-top-tech-newsletters-to-subscribe-to-) [1. Tech Crunch](https://clickup.com/blog/tech-newsletters/#2-1-tech-crunch-) [2. Tech Daily](https://clickup.com/blog/tech-newsletters/#3-2-tech-daily-) [3. Bizarro Devs](https://clickup.com/blog/tech-newsletters/#4-3-bizarro-devs-) [4. CIO](https://clickup.com/blog/tech-newsletters/#5-4-cio-) [5. Lenny’s Newsletter](https://clickup.com/blog/tech-newsletters/#6-5-lenny%E2%80%99s-newsletter-) [6. Product Hunt](https://clickup.com/blog/tech-newsletters/#7-6-product-hunt-) [7. The Download](https://clickup.com/blog/tech-newsletters/#10-9-the-download-) [10. NextDraft](https://clickup.com/blog/tech-newsletters/#11-10-nextdraft-) [11. Interesting Engineering](https://clickup.com/blog/tech-newsletters/#12-11-interesting-engineering-) [12. KnowTechie’s The Weekly Download](https://clickup.com/blog/tech-newsletters/#13-12-knowtechie%E2%80%99s-the-weekly-download-) [13. Import AI](https://clickup.com/blog/tech-newsletters/#14-13-import-ai-) [14. CB Insights](https://clickup.com/blog/tech-newsletters/#15-14-cb-insights-) [15. Benedict’s Newsletter](https://clickup.com/blog/tech-newsletters/#16-15-benedict%E2%80%99s-newsletter-) [16. The Intelligent Worker](https://clickup.com/blog/tech-newsletters/#17-16-the-intelligent-worker-) [17. Internet Is Beautiful](https://clickup.com/blog/tech-newsletters/#18-17-internet-is-beautiful-) [18. The Information](https://clickup.com/blog/tech-newsletters/#19-18-the-information-) [19. Dense Discovery](https://clickup.com/blog/tech-newsletters/#20-19-dense-discovery-) [20. Tedium](https://clickup.com/blog/tech-newsletters/#21-20-tedium-) [Feeling Inspired to Create Your Own Newsletter?](https://clickup.com/blog/tech-newsletters/#22-feeling-inspired-to-create-your-own-newsletter-) Why Should You Subscribe to Tech Newsletters?Subscribing to tech newsletters is like having a personal assistant deliver the most important news, insights, and reviews directly to you, tailored to your specific interests.Tech newsletters can be a valuable source of personalized content, helping you stay informed about the latest trends and developments in your areas of interest.Beyond staying informed, these newsletters can also be a great way to connect with like-minded individuals and build your professional network. Many newsletters feature forums or social media groups where you can discuss, share ideas, and collaborate with others.Some tech blogs and newsletters also offer exclusive content or early access to new products and services, helping you stay up-to-date with the industry advancements.Also Read: [The best engineering podcasts](https://clickup.com/blog/engineering-podcasts/) Summarize this article with AI ClickUp Brain not only saves you precious time by instantly summarizing articles, it also leverages AI to connect your tasks, docs, people, and more, streamlining your workflow like never before. Summarize article Summarize this article for me please Want to save even more time? [ Try ClickUp Brain free ](https://app.clickup.com/signup?product=ai&ai=true) 20 Top Tech Newsletters to Subscribe To1. Tech CrunchVia: [TechCrunch](https://techcrunch.com/newsletters/) Launch year: 2005Subscribers: 17 million+Newsletter schedule: Daily and weeklyTechCrunch’s newsletter brings you a daily dose of tech innovation. From groundbreaking startups to industry-shaping trends, their newsletter delivers the most essential news, insights, and inspiration straight to your inbox.TechCrunch offers various newsletters tailored to specific interests, such as daily news briefings, deep dives into startups, or in-depth coverage of topics like artificial intelligence, fintech, and more.Enjoy diverse content, including news about startup funding, product launches, industry analysis, and thought leadership pieces. Why we like it: Their global audience and expert contributors provide a comprehensive overview of the tech world.2. Tech DailyVia: [Tech Daily](https://www.bloomberg.com/account/newsletters/technology) Launch year: UnavailableSubscribers: UnavailableNewsletter schedule: DailyTech Daily delivers a daily dose of essential tech news curated by Bloomberg’s journalists. Their newsletter offers a selection of the day’s most important news related to technology and AI delivered directly to your inbox.The newsletter features in-depth analysis from Bloomberg’s experienced tech reporters, offering valuable insights and perspectives. Readers particularly enjoy the ‘Three things you need to know today’ callouts, which bring them up to speed with the most important current events in tech. Whether you’re interested in product launches, corporate strategies, or tech policy, this newsletter brings valuable insights directly to your inbox, making it a must-read for anyone serious about tech.Why we like it: The expert analysis to help less tech-savvy readers make better sense of what’s happening in the technology world.3. Bizarro DevsVia: [Bizzaro Devs](https://bizarrodevs.wpshout.com/) Launch year: 2017Subscribers: 10,000+Newsletter schedule: MonthlyIf you’re into offbeat tech stories and enjoy a mix of unusual facts and practical tools, BizzaroDevs is the perfect newsletter for you. Delivered monthly, it curates the quirkiest and most fascinating tech news, highlighting ten standout stories and diving deeper into three of them for added context. In addition to the main content, the newsletter features fun sections with interesting facts, memorable quotes, and handy tools that can enhance your daily workflow. Why we like it: A unique, entertaining read for anyone looking for a fresh take on technology.4. CIOVia: [CIO](https://www.cio.com/newsletters/signup/) Launch year: UnavailableSubscribers: UnavailableNewsletter schedule: Daily and weeklyCIO offers practical tips and advice on various topics, from technology implementation to leadership development. It features contributions from leading IT experts, providing valuable insights and analysis.The newsletter curates the most important news and trends in the IT industry with daily and weekly updates. It has eight separate newsletter offerings, each offering the latest news, trends, and analysis on the topics that matter most to IT leaders.Why we like it: Insights curated keeping CIOs and enterprise tech leaders in mind.5. Lenny’s NewsletterVia: [Lenny’s Newsletter](https://www.lennysnewsletter.com/) Launch year: 2018Subscribers: 790,000+Newsletter schedule: Weekly and monthlyCrafted by Lenny Rachitsky, a former product manager at Dropbox, Lenny’s Newsletter offers expert insights from a seasoned tech professional. This weekly and monthly newsletter provides practical tips and strategies that you can apply to your own career.Lenny’s Newsletter is one of the top tech newsletters on Substack. It offers perspectives on product management, growth strategies, and career development.💡Bonus Tip: Newsletters like this one are hosted on Substack. If you’re looking for similar tools, take a look at our list of [Substack alternatives](https://clickup.com/blog/substack-alternatives/) .Each week, Lenny answers reader questions on topics like product-market fit, go-to-market strategies, and leadership challenges. Paying subscribers receive a weekly newsletter, along with access to a subscriber-only Slack community of over 15,000 members and exclusive resources like discounts and curated directories.Non-paying subscribers still benefit from a free monthly post, making it a valuable resource for anyone looking to grow in the tech industry.Why we like it: The go-to resource for up-and-coming product managers and tech workers to sharpen their knowledge.6. Product HuntVia: [Product Hunt](https://www.producthunt.com/newsletters) Launch year: 2013Subscribers: UnavailableNewsletter schedule: Daily and weeklyThe Product Hunt newsletters are daily and weekly digests that curate the best new tech products, helping you discover the most innovative tools, software, and gadgets in the industry. Each edition highlights top product launches, key industry trends, and news from the tech world. Whether you’re a startup enthusiast, product developer, or tech lover, the newsletters ensure you’re always in the loop with fresh updates delivered straight to your inbox. With their community-driven approach, Product Hunt newsletters connect readers to the latest breakthroughs and innovations, making them a go-to resource for tech professionals and enthusiasts alike.​Why we like it: Essential reading for keeping track of new products and tools.7. Hacker NewsletterVia: [hackernewsletter](https://hackernewsletter.com/) Launch year: 2010Subscribers: 60,000+Newsletter schedule: WeeklyHacker Newsletter is curated personally by prolific programmer Kale Davis. This weekly email is a favorite among tech enthusiasts, developers, and startup founders. It features handpicked links to the most interesting articles, news, and resources from Hacker News and across the web. Whether it’s programming, startup news, or the top stories in tech, the newsletter provides a concise and valuable selection of content, making it a great resource for busy techies. Delivered straight to your inbox every Friday, it’s a simple way to stay updated on the latest trends and innovations in the tech world.Why we like it: The no-fuss layout with themes like ‘Design,’ ‘Startup News,’ ‘Fun,’ and so on. 8. TLDRVia: [TLDR](https://tldr.tech/newsletters) Launch year: 2018Subscribers: 1.2 million+Newsletter schedule: DailyTLDR delivers daily newsletters covering a wide range of tech news, including updates on startups, cutting-edge research, and the latest trends in AI, blockchain, programming, and more.  Perfect for busy professionals, the concise daily digest provides quick summaries of the most important tech news in just five minutes. The free newsletter focuses on topics such as web development, AI trends, information security, DevOps, and product management and is read by over 1.2 million subscribers worldwide.If you’re looking for a quick, informative read to keep up with important developments in the tech world, TLDR is an excellent resource.Why we like it: The format—it respects your time!9. The DownloadVia: [The Download](https://www.technologyreview.com/topic/download-newsletter/) Launch year: UnavailableSubscribers: UnavailableNewsletter schedule: DailyBacked by the prestigious MIT Technology Review, The Download leverages the knowledge of leading researchers and experts. Delivered every weekday, it provides in-depth reporting on topics that matter now and prepares readers for what’s coming next in the tech world. Whether it’s AI advancements, scientific breakthroughs, or policy changes, The Download keeps you informed on key trends shaping the future.It’s a go-to source for anyone looking to stay updated on tech with thoughtful and authoritative journalism.Why we like it: Expert insights on emerging technologies.10. NextDraftVia: [NextDraft](https://nextdraft.com/) Launch year: 2010Subscribers: 128,000+Newsletter schedule: DailyNextDraft is a daily newsletter curated by Dave Pell, also known as the ‘Internet’s Managing Editor.’ Rather than relying on algorithms, Pell personally selects and summarizes the day’s most captivating news, adding his own humor and insights. Whether you’re looking for the latest tech breakthroughs or thought-provoking articles on social issues, NextDraft condenses it all into an easy-to-read format. It’s a refreshing take on news curation, offering readers a mix of wit, sharp analysis, and entertainment—all delivered straight to your inbox for free​.Why we like it: Pell’s uniquely funny take on tech news.11. Interesting EngineeringVia: [Interesting Engineering](https://interestingengineering.com/newsletters?All) Launch year: UnavailableSubscribers: UnavailableNewsletter schedule: Daily, weekly, and monthlyThe Interesting Engineering newsletters offer a diverse range of content focused on science, technology, and engineering. They cover groundbreaking innovations, engineering feats, and the future of technology across sectors like aerospace, sustainability, AI, and more. The free daily digest and subscriber-only weekly editions are carefully curated, providing readers with in-depth articles, the latest news, and insightful commentary on the most fascinating developments in these fields.In addition, you can subscribe to monthly newsletters that go deep into specific topics—mechanics, AI, aerospace engineering, tech careers, and more. The breadth of topics is ideal for tech enthusiasts and professionals alike. Whether you’re interested in cutting-edge engineering, the latest in tech innovation, or how science is shaping our future, these newsletters are a go-to resource for staying updated on all things tech​.Why we like it: The wide range of topics you can learn about.12. KnowTechie’s The Weekly DownloadVia: [KnowTechie’s Weekly Download](https://mail.knowtechie.com/) Launch year: UnavailableSubscribers: UnavailableNewsletter schedule: WeeklyThe KnowTechie’s Weekly Download is a must-read tech newsletter that delivers a roundup of the most important tech stories you might have missed each week. It’s designed for those who want to stay informed without being overwhelmed by endless news feeds. The newsletter covers tech tips, news, top finds, deals, and even fun trivia, making it a well-rounded source of information for tech enthusiasts and casual readers alike.Whether you’re a parent, student, or professional, this newsletter simplifies complex tech topics, so you can enjoy the latest news without the jargon. Plus, KnowTechie mixes things up with giveaways and free stuff, ensuring there’s always something exciting in each edition.Why we like it:​ The approachable, conversational tone—perfect for readers who love tech but don’t live and breathe it. 13. Import AIVia: [Import AI](https://importai.substack.com/) Launch year: 2016Subscribers: 58,000+Newsletter schedule: WeeklyCurated by Jack Clark, co-founder of Anthropic (an AI safety and research company), the Import AI newsletter offers insights from a leading figure in AI and machine learning.Import AI is one of the [best AI newsletters](https://clickup.com/blog/best-ai-newsletters/) today, delivering insightful content weekly so you can stay informed about the latest AI developments.It encourages deeper understanding and discussion around AI, potentially influencing the future direction of the technology. The newsletter incorporates summaries of relevant research papers, keeping readers up-to-date on the latest advancements.Why we like it: Clark’s depth of expertise in all things AI.14. CB InsightsVia: [CB Insights](https://www.cbinsights.com/newsletter/) Launch year: 2017Subscribers: 1 million+Newsletter schedule: 4 times a weekThe CB Insights newsletter is a go-to resource for anyone looking to stay ahead of industry trends, innovation, and data-driven insights. Backed by expert analysis and extensive data, it provides in-depth coverage of the latest in venture capital, startups, and emerging technologies. What sets it apart is are actionable insights backed by comprehensive research and data analysis.Whether you’re an entrepreneur, investor, or tech professional, this newsletter gives you a competitive edge by highlighting key industry shifts, emerging business models, and groundbreaking technological advancements.One of the best features of the CB Insights newsletter is its ability to distill complex market trends into digestible insights that you can apply directly to your business or investment strategies. Why we like it: It’s perfect for those who want to stay informed on how technology is shaping industries without getting overwhelmed by too much technical jargon.15. Benedict’s NewsletterVia: [Benedict Evans](https://www.ben-evans.com/newsletter) Launch year: 1999Subscribers: 175,000+Newsletter schedule: WeeklyBenedict’s Newsletter is your go-to source for expert analysis on the week’s most important tech developments. With over 20 years of experience, Benedict Evans breaks down complex industry trends, offering you the in-depth insights and perspectives needed to stay ahead.The newsletter is available in both free and premium versions. While the free version offers his insightful weekly column, premium subscribers get exclusive access to the complete newsletter archive—an invaluable resource for understanding trends and gaining a competitive edge. Whether you’re a tech enthusiast, a professional, or simply curious about the latest innovations, Benedict’s Newsletter delivers the expert analysis you need to stay informed and up-to-date.Why we like it: Gives you not just tech news but also the context around it.16. The Intelligent WorkerVia: [The Intelligent Worker](https://www.newsletter.theintelligentworker.com/) Launch year: UnavailableSubscribers: 85,000+Newsletter schedule: Bi-weeklyWritten and managed by Henry Habib, The Intelligent Worker newsletter offers a glimpse into the future of work, where artificial intelligence is transforming how we work. The Intelligent Worker newsletter focuses on helping professionals boost productivity by making the most of AI, automation, and no-code tools. Delivered weekly, it offers practical insights, real-world use cases, and trending tools designed to enhance workplace efficiency. Whether you’re looking to save time or optimize workflows, this newsletter provides actionable advice without the fluff. It’s a must-read for anyone serious about staying ahead in the evolving tech landscape. Why we like it: One of the best tech newsletters for modern professionals seeking to harness the power of technology in their daily work.17. Internet Is BeautifulVia: [Internet is Beautiful](https://internetisbeautiful.com/) Launch year: 2016Subscribers: 10,000+Newsletter schedule: WeeklyInternet is Beautiful is your go-to source for discovering the coolest and most interesting finds from all over the web. Each week, join thousands of readers who receive a curated list of the best new websites, tech tools, and online products.From inspiring articles and captivating videos to engaging tweets and insightful reads from other technology newsletters, Internet is Beautiful brings you the most exciting and relevant content the Internet offers. Why we like it: It helps you stay up-to-date on web design and development trends while exploring hidden gems and expanding your online horizons.18. The InformationVia: [The Information](https://www.theinformation.com/newsletters) Launch year: 2013Subscribers: UnavailableNewsletter schedule: Daily and weeklyThe Information Newsletter is highly regarded as one of the best tech newsletters for professionals seeking in-depth, exclusive reporting on the technology industry. Covering everything from venture capital and startups to major industry shifts, it provides unparalleled insights that go beyond the surface level. With a focus on original, well-researched content, The Information keeps you ahead of key trends and offers valuable analysis that you won’t find elsewhere.The newsletter is ideal for executives, investors, and tech enthusiasts who need a trusted source for timely, deeply-reported stories. Subscribing not only gives you access to their comprehensive reports but also exclusive newsletters covering AI, the creator economy, deal-making, and more. It’s one of the top tech newsletters to follow if you’re serious about staying informed on the business and innovation driving the tech industry.Why we like it: Deeply reported, editorial-style articles with a ton of value.19. Dense DiscoveryVia: [Dense Discovery](https://www.densediscovery.com/) Launch year: 2018Subscribers: 37,000+Newsletter schedule: WeeklyDense Discovery is one of the most thoughtful and well-curated tech newsletters you can subscribe to, especially if you’re interested in the intersection of technology, design, and culture. Delivered weekly, it brings a handpicked selection of useful apps, tools, books, and thought-provoking reads. What sets it apart is its focus on sustainability, urbanism, and tech, offering a fresh perspective that goes beyond the typical hype-filled headlines.Dense Discovery is, in their own words, “proudly independent and algorithm-free,” ensuring you get a unique and meaningful experience in every issue. Whether you’re looking to discover inspiring projects or expand your knowledge with deep, reflective content, this newsletter offers a beautifully designed and carefully curated collection of links that are worth your time.Why we like it: Their carbon offsetting program plants a tree for every newsletter sent out.20. TediumVia: [Tedium](https://tedium.co/) Launch year: 2015Subscribers: 10,000+Newsletter schedule: Bi-weeklyTedium is a newsletter for those who appreciate deep dives into the strange and unusual. Instead of chasing viral trends, Tedium shines a light on the overlooked and mundane, exploring the stories behind everyday technologies and ideas that rarely get the attention they deserve. Each article is carefully crafted to provide context and storytelling around interesting stories and subjects that require closer examination to reveal their true significance.With over 12,000 regular readers, Tedium is not just about information—it’s about curiosity and discovery. If you’re tired of the same old tech news and want something thought-provoking and different, Tedium is the newsletter for you. Why we like it: Its unique take on the mundane, presented with humor and depth, makes it one of the best tech newsletters to subscribe to for anyone looking to learn something truly new and unexpected. TechCrunch.Description: With more than 17 million monthly readers, TechCrunch not only runs one of the top blogs in the industry but also produces nearly a dozen different industry-focused newsletters.

Stratechery.Description: With a strong academic background, and work experience that ranges from Apple to Microsoft, author Ben Thompson is considered one of the most respected observers in the tech space.

Box of Amazing.Description: Promoted as condensing three hours of stories into three minutes, Box of Amazing covers a wide variety of tech topics.

Digital Trends.Description: Famous for their in-depth, unbiased reviews of cool and cutting-edge tech products.

Internet is Beautiful.Description: Shares the best websites, tools, articles, videos each week, helping readers stay up-to-date on the latest web design and development trends.

Next Draft.Description: A replacement for the algorithms used to aggregate news, authored by Dave Pel, and trusted by people who write the news.

Exponential View.Description: Focuses almost exclusively on exponential technologies, curated by Azeem Azhard.

Futurism.Description: Covers fun, light-hearted approaches to how technology might shape our future.

wpMail.Description: Considered by many to be the best WordPress newsletter around.

SRE Weekly.Description: Covers the ins and outs of website outages and explores why websites and platforms go down.

Sidebar.io.Description: Delivers 5 design links to your inbox every day, covering graphic design, UI, and UX.

Modern CTO Weekly.Description: Helps tech executives stay abreast of the most important developments in the space, with content derived from interviews with industry heavyweights.

Accessibility Weekly.description: A weekly dose of web accessibility to help you bring it into your everyday work. Delivered to your inbox each Monday, curated by David A. Kennedy.

Bloomberg - Fully Charged.description: Get daily exclusive insights from Bloombergʼs technology reporters around the world in Fully Charged.

Changelog Nightly.description: Changelog is an indie media company covering every facet of a software developer's journey -- inventing, making, building, shipping, leading, founding, and thinking. Delivered every night @ 10pm US Central.

Changelog Weekly.description: Changelog is an indie media company covering every facet of a software developer's journey -- inventing, making, building, shipping, leading, founding, and thinking. Delivered every weekend.

Diversify Tech.description: A collection of resources for underrepresented people in tech.

Frontend Focus.description: A once–weekly roundup of the best front-end news, articles and tutorials. HTML, CSS, WebGL, Canvas, browser tech, and more.

Frontend Weekly.description: The best articles, links and news related to Frontend Development delivered once a week to your inbox.

GeePaw Weekly.description: A community of like-minded teams and individuals pushing forward the industry of software development.

guidance counselor 2.0 newsletter.description: A newsletter from the perspective of a recruiter trying to make the job search less terrifying to everyone in tech.

SaaS Bites.description: Latest news, tips, and tools for SaaS growth, marketing, and product management.

Other Valleys.description: Tracking emerging markets' innovation, technology, business and creativity.

rendezvous with cassidoo.description: A weekly newsletter with new and cool things in tech, interview question of the week, jokes, stories and occasional pictures of lovely mechanical keyboards.

Software Defined Talk.description: A podcast about Enterprise Software and Cloud Computing that doesn't take itself too seriously.

Stefan's Web Weekly.description: Sign up to start every week with quick-to-read Web Development learnings, productivity tricks, useful GitHub projects, #devsheets and music that keeps you going.

Techpresso.description: Join 100,000+ free daily readers for the latest tech news, tools and insights.

TechRepublic Developer Essentials.description: The TechRepublic team has one simple goal: helping you make great decisions about technology.

The Daily Byte.description: A single problem each day, in an order that encourages learning as opposed to rote memorization.

Virtual Coffee.description: Keep up to date with all things Virtual Coffee with the monthly Newsletter!

The Travis.vc Newsletter.Description: A weekly investing & startup newsletter curated by our fantastic startup & investing community. It filters through the noise to send you a curated email with the best startup, investing, bootstrapping, and entrepreneur stories of the week.

Investing.io.Description: The investing.io startup newsletter is brought to you by Travis Jamison, founder of investing.io and a dozen other bootstrapped companies. It stands out by bringing tech news, startup news, private businesses for sale, DeFi opportunities, experimental tools, marketing strategy, and more all in one place.

Benedict Evans Newsletter.Description: Benedict Evans, a well-regarded analyst and venture capitalist, sends out his startup newsletter once a week to an audience of over 175,000 people. It focuses on changes and ideas that truly matter, cutting through the noise to provide context and analysis.

Y Combinator Newsletter.Description: Y Combinator's newsletter offers access to a wealth of resources that help navigate the challenging terrain of starting and scaling a business. It covers topics like fundraising, product development, marketing, and more.

Indie Hackers.Description: The Indiehackers newsletter is a rich resource for business owners, especially those running startups. It provides a wide array of perspectives and insights, not just a single viewpoint, and practical advice for early-stage founders.

Daily Dropout.Description: The Daily Dropout is a startup newsletter that provides insights into university startups from around the USA. It aims to give early access to the next big companies and technologies.

SaaS Weekly.Description: SaaS Weekly is compiled by Hiten Shah, a well-known figure in the SaaS industry. It covers business, marketing, sales, and focuses on product development, providing insights on creating better products efficiently and effectively.

Lolita’s Newsletter.Description: "Lolita’s Newsletter" is written by Lolita Taub, a General Partner at Ganas Ventures. It offers actionable content for underestimated founders, funders, and friends, providing a platform for startup founders to showcase their businesses.

Hacker News Digest.Description: The Hacker News Digest startup newsletter delivers the top stories from Hacker News to your inbox daily, keeping you up to date with the latest in technology news without being swamped by data.

The Growth Letter.Description: "The Growth Letter" is written as a roadmap for business expansion and an entrepreneurial companion, curated by Tim Cakir. It provides subscribers with actionable growth tips, insightful recommendations, and knowledge gained from helping businesses scale.

First 1000.Description: The First 1000 is a newsletter by Ali Abouelatta that shares the journeys of tech firms going from zero to their first 1000 customers, offering an inspirational guide for aspiring entrepreneurs.

Founder Insights.Overview: The Founder Institute has a newsletter spotlighting inspiring founder stories, sharing proven frameworks, and providing beneficial tools to smoothen your entrepreneurial journey.
Founder Insights.Value Proposition: Delivers actionable advice from those who have been in the trenches, making it invaluable for founders looking to learn from the experiences of others.
Founder Insights.Content Quality: High-quality content that’s both practical and motivational, with a focus on real-world application.
Founder Insights.Ideal Audience: Early-stage founders who would appreciate hands-on advice and inspiration from successful peers.
Founder Insights.Why Is It Different: It has two versions - Updates and Editorial - both extremely handy and easy to digest. Gives access to a wide variety of content: videos, webinars, blog articles, social media posts, podcasts, etc.

Open Source CEO.Overview: A community built by Bill Kerr, founder and CEO at Athyna, focusing on content about tools and resources, ranging from playbooks, databases, courses, and more.
Open Source CEO.Value Proposition: Offers in-depth analysis of tools and technologies that can be leveraged to build and scale startups.
Key Topics: Deep dives on famous visionary leaders
Open Source CEO.Content Quality: Detailed and well-researched, with hints that are particularly useful for technically-minded founders.
Open Source CEO.Ideal Audience: Founders and CTOs involved with the technical and business growth aspects of startup development.
Open Source CEO.Why Is It Different: Serious topics are elaborated in a fun way; lots of pop culture references and designs.

Houck’s Newsletter.Overview: Written by serial entrepreneur Michael Houck, offering a unique blend of startup advice, industry analysis, and personal insights.
Houck’s Newsletter.Value Proposition: Provides a mix of strategic advice and thought-provoking commentary, helping founders thrive in the broader startup ecosystem.
Houck’s Newsletter.Content Quality: Shrewd and engaging, with a focus on both practical advice and big-picture thinking.
Houck’s Newsletter.Ideal Audience: Founders and startup leaders looking for tactical recommendations on building, growing, and raising capital for their startups.
Houck’s Newsletter.Why Is It Different: Comprehensive, profound, and a treasure trove of frameworks.

Seedtable.Overview: A data platform and newsletter on European tech founded by Gonz Sanchez, bringing analysis, news, and insights on startups and venture capital.
Seedtable.Value Proposition: Covers in detail the European startup scene and how it affects society, making it a must-read for those operating in or interested in this market.
Seedtable.Content Quality: High-quality, with a strong emphasis on data-driven analysis and regional insights.
Seedtable.Ideal Audience: Founders, investors, and entrepreneurs interested in the European tech landscape.
Seedtable.Why Is It Different: Convenient links and access to a vast amount of sorted global data.

MKT1.Overview: Emily Kramer, with over 15+ years of experience, shares marketing-focused insights.
MKT1.Value Proposition: Provides actionable marketing advice from industry veterans, essential for startup founders looking to build and scale their marketing efforts.
MKT1.Content Quality: Actionable, with a focus on practical tips and strategies that can be immediately applied.
MKT1.Ideal Audience: Startup founders, CMOs, marketers, and growth teams looking for expert, pragmatic guidance on marketing in a startup environment.
MKT1.Why Is It Different: Laser-focused, organized, and spanning basically all aspects of B2B marketing.

The Founder Playbook.Overview: Brought to you by The Hustle Fund, offering tactical, straightforward advice on fundraising and scaling your startup.
The Founder Playbook.Value Proposition: Relies on the expertise of seasoned investors and entrepreneurs, helping founders tackle real-world challenges and grow their businesses effectively.
The Founder Playbook.Content Quality: High-quality, straightforward content that focuses on delivering actionable tips and clear takeaways.
The Founder Playbook.Ideal Audience: Early-stage founders and startup leaders looking for practical, investor-backed guidance.
The Founder Playbook.Why Is It Different: Incredibly simplified, The Founder Playbook flows effortlessly and captivates.

The Hustle.Overview: A daily newsletter delivering a mix of business news, tech updates, and startup stories with a punchy, often humorous tone.
The Hustle.Value Proposition: Perfect for staying informed on the latest trends and stories in the business world, with a format that’s both engaging and easy to digest.
The Hustle.Content Quality: High-quality, concise, and engaging, with a blend of hard news and lighter
The Hustle.Ideal Audience: Entrepreneurs and business professionals who want a quick, entertaining overview of what’s happening in the world of startups and tech.
The Hustle.Why Is It Different: Visually appealing and with an endless array of themes.

Bay Area Times.Overview: Informs about the tech scene, covering global news, trends, and events.
Bay Area Times.Value Proposition: Essential for founders who like to consume with concise visual analysis for each story, joined by a community of 250,000+ subscribers.
Bay Area Times.Content Quality: High-quality, with a focus on relevant and timely information.
Bay Area Times.Why Is It Different: Links visualizations to stories, making them easy to understand and memorize.

Not Boring.Overview: Merges storytelling and crisp analysis on tech, startups, and venture capital.
Not Boring.Value Proposition: Combines engaging narratives with research, making complex topics accessible and interesting for founders.
Not Boring.Content Quality: High-quality, with a strong focus on making complex concepts engaging and easy to understand.
Not Boring.Ideal Audience: Founders and startup enthusiasts who enjoy exploring new ideas and perspectives through well-crafted stories.
Not Boring.Why Is It Different: Unlimited topics and catchy headlines like The Daily Dose of Optimism.

First Round Review.Overview: An extension of First Round Capital’s library of startup knowledge, offering actionable advice from industry leaders.
First Round Review.Value Proposition: Provides in-depth articles, interviews with successful founders, and guides that you can directly apply to your business.
First Round Review.Content Quality: Exceptionally high, with well-researched articles featuring exclusive wisdom from industry experts.
First Round Review.Ideal Audience: Early-stage founders and curious startup teams looking for deep dives and validated tactics.
First Round Review.Why Is It Different: Remarkably on-point, educational, and inspirational at the same time.

StrictlyVC.Overview: A newsletter dedicated to the venture capital landscape, providing news, analysis, and insights for founders and investors.
StrictlyVC.Value Proposition: Shares insider news and trends in venture capital, helping founders seeking investment understand the VC ecosystem.
StrictlyVC.Content Quality: Highly informative and particularly useful for those navigating the world of venture capital.
StrictlyVC.Ideal Audience: Founders actively fundraising or interested in learning more about the VC landscape, venture capitalists, and corporate innovators.
StrictlyVC.Why Is It Different: It has a diverse audience and always follows a specific, clean structure.

Every.Overview: A long-form daily newsletter revealing different perspectives on business, tech, and personal development.
Every.Value Proposition: Delivers a wide range of forecasts and outlooks in an essay form: ‘It’s not news, it’s context and opinion.’
Every.Content Quality: Premium, thought-provoking content with a focus on original viewpoints and expert commentary.
Every.Why Is It Different: It’s truly one of a kind for its outstanding design and beautiful writing.

Inc. This Morning Newsletter.Description: Curates daily news digest for those interested in entrepreneurship.
